intro: Epilobium euphrasioides, commonly known as the purple sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense spikes, and are usually pink or purple in color. Epilobium euphrasioides is often found in open habitats such as meadows, woodland edges, and coastal areas.
